channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Various items dumped on the Parkside estate side of the pavement, 19th August
item.description:
The items are all on Morpeth road between the junction with Skipworth and the junction with Morpeth Grove. Thank you.

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Rutland Road, Hackney, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Fly tipping/junk on Manley court, 19th August
item.description:
Loads of collected / ditched furniture, clothes, old household furniture etc which has been there untouched for months. Mostly under a cover but there’s discarded trolleys & prams next to it. A man collects metal next to it with permission, but not these.

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Manley Court, Hackney, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Overhanging tree, 19th August
item.description:
There is a tree which is located outside 17 Villiers rd BR3 4NR, the tree needs to be pruned as it’s blocking my cctv camera which is used to protect my property and car. The tree is dropping yellow buds which get brought into the house and cover the car, this is affecting my car as it’s beginning to block the windscreen vents, daily I am having to clear the car to enable me to see clearly through the screen as the yellow buds stick to the screen when wet…

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Villiers Road, Penge, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Car in parking bay beyond time restriction, 19th August
item.description:
This car has been parked in the bay for at least three days, saying for sale and preventing others from using it. I believe parking is for two hours only with no return for two hours. The road is in the CPZ so parking is at a premium between 10 and 12 and this is selfish. Previously it was parked in the alleyway behind the shops but this now has new notices saying it is private parking. There are no PCNs on the windscreen so enforcement officers not doing anything about it.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Oldfield Road, London
Report on FixMyStreet
item.category: Vehicles for sale on the public road

item.title: FLYTIPPING ON PATHWAY (FOOTPATH)DUMPED FURNITURE & BAGSniture & bags, 19th August
item.description:
Resident reporting along the footpath from Bellegrove road into Ruskin Driver there are 2 fridges, settee & wood & 1 roll of carpet and lots of black & white sacks & clear bags which are full of recycling. There is a sign up but being ignored. Please could someone look into this asap. It is all facing towards the flats - Welling Court flats. The other settee is on the other side of the railings towards Welling field Court
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Ruskin Drive, Welling, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Two lights needs replacing, 19th August
item.description:
Hi there, two street lights needs replacing in Cardine mews SE15 1AY. It is very dark and we had issues in Friday evening where 10 youths came around jumping over peoples gardens. Police were called and they came around with sniffer dogs etc. The lights needs replacing ASAP as it is attracting criminals and the elderly homeowners are very scared.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Cardine Mews, Peckham, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Taviton Street, Santander Cycles: Bloomsbury Taviton Street dock, 19th August
item.description:
This temporary sign is blocking access to park / remove the bicycles in this santander cycle dock. It is making it difficult to park bikes as it blocks the path between where the road and pavement are at level, and the dock, where you can easily wheel a heavy bike onto the road. Please could this signage be moved so that it is not blocking access to the bicycles.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 4, Taviton Street, Saint Pancras, London
Report on FixMyStreet
